Frequently.title: Does React JS work on the front end or the back end ?
Frequently.desc: In essence, React JS is a front-end library, which is used to create elements that users can interact with through their browsers.

Frequently.title: Why should you use React JS ?
Frequently.desc: User interfaces and components can be built with React. Single-page and progressive web apps generally use it for fetching rapidly changing data that needs to be stored

Frequently.title: Can React JS handle large applications ?
Frequently.desc: React can be used to develop large applications, but it is mainly used to create small apps like single-page apps and progressive web apps.

Frequently.title: React JS is a web technology, right? Can React JS be used to build mobile apps ?
Frequently.desc: Web development is the only use of React.js. No mobile apps can be built with it.
